CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 10, 1958, pg. 32, reads: "Opening Day - Members of the Tommy Smith All-Stars, left photo, charged onto Ammon Field last Thursday for the opening game of the Ammon Slow Pitch League.  The All-Stars, defending champions in the 10-game loop, won the opener, beating the Knights of Williams and Luck, 7-3.  In the photo on the right are some of the luminaries who took part in the opening-day ceremonies.  Left to right are Magistrate 'Pappy' Williams, who backs the W. & L. team; Bob Hall, their captain; Gabe Patterson, manager of the All-Stars; Charlie Betts, president of the league; Constable Tommy Smith, backer of the All-Stars; Fuzzy Walton, team captain, K. Leroy Irvis, assistant District Attorney of Allegheny County, and Ralph D. Gloster, Fifth Ward committeeman. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Robert "Pappy" Williams, Tommy Smith All-Stars softball team captain Bob Hall, manager Gabe Patterson, league president Charlie Betts, Constable "Tommy" Smith, Fuzzy Walton, K. Leroy Irvis, and Ralph D. Gloster on opening day of Ammon Slow Pitch League
